name: National Hispanic Heritage Month
description: Running from September 15 to October 15, Hispanic Heritage Month is all about paying tribute to the generations of Hispanic and Latino Americans who've enriched our communities in so many ways: business, art, cuisine, and more.

name: Fall will fly by fast.
description: October and November are two of the most popular spending months of the year. Offering seasonally specific products or services is a great way to draw those dollars in your customer's direction. As the season changes and folks gear up for the holidays, try creating content that meets their needs and solves their problems.

name: It's time for Fall Break.
description: Many schools across the country offer a break for students in October. That means parents looking to keep kids busy, college students coming home for the week, or families taking a quick vacation together. Try offering simple solutions to these problems, seasonal promotions, or highlight products to coincide with the break.

name: Help out the host this season.
description: Tailgating, potlucks, and gathering around a tv are staples during college football season. Plan to help out the hosts during this time by offering deals on catering, to-go specials, or even home maintenance promotions to keep things running smoothly when guests arrive.

name: Broadway is back.
description: The long-awaited return of Broadway has finally arrived. Audiences are back in theaters and they couldn't be happier.

name: Dreaming of Fall
description: Sweltering temps don't seem to keep the internet from dreaming of crisp autumn nights, a cozy sweater, and spooky Halloween decor. Folks all over are engaging with audiences over their favorite fall scents, new decor ideas, and the question of whether or not it's too early to dream of fall at all.

name: Tactile hobbies continue to rise
description: Find a hobby, but make it cool. Folks are leaning into hands-on activities like colorful embroidery and one-of-a-kind leatherworking. Activities like bottle painting, ceramics, and crocheting, are popping up more and more on feeds across platforms. Can your customer offer tips to help crafters keep their new DIY hobby organized? Or maybe restaurants offering delivery or pick-up orders offer quick solutions to help creatives spend less time in the kitchen and more time focused on their latest project?

name: The "Greenaissance"
description: There’s a new sense of urgency to take better care of the planet. As people reevaluated their priorities during COVID, they realized they want to live more sustainably. Now, they're building new routines and taking action on a greener lifestyle. A recent study shows 4 in 5 consumers plan to continue taking action on a more sustainable lifestyle in their “new normal.” This means folks are looking to eat clean, buy green, and drive lean. They're looking for new ideas and products to help them on their way. Look to see if your customers provide any eco-friendly, sustainable products or utilize best practices in their business that are good for the planet.

name: Gardeners Rejoice
description: This horticultural hobby shows no signs of slowing down this year. . Things like herb gardens, home-grown produce, and perfecting lawn care will all be top of mind. Do your customers offer any gardening services, weed/pest control services, or tips for yard maintenance? Maybe they can offer ways to use home-grown veggies in healthy recipes or guidance around the stress relieving properties of gardening.

name: Hurricane season
description: The Atlantic hurricane season is the period in a year from June through November when hurricanes usually form in the Atlantic Ocean. Tropical cyclones in the North Atlantic are called hurricanes, tropical storms, or tropical depressions. In 2021, the NOAA predicted between 13 and 20 named storms (those with wind speeds of 39 mph. or higher), six to 10 hurricanes (with 74 mph. winds or higher) and three to five major hurricanes (with 111 mph. winds and above). Look to see if your customer offers warranties around hurricane damage or emergency services.

name: Solar installations
description: With a rise in increasingly unpredictable/extreme weather, many homeowners are considering and turning to solar power as an alternative to traditional energy sources. U.S. solar installations increased by 46% in the first quarter of 2021. There are some businesses that solely focus on solar installations and maintenance, but it is often a service provided across a number of home service verticals.  #SolarEnergy

name: Electricity conservation
description: There are many ways to reduce the use of electricity in homes during the hotter months. Common recommendations include setting your thermostat to 78 degrees or more, utilizing fans, closing blinds in windows receiving direct sunlight, and not using large appliances like dishwashers, washing machines, and ovens.

name: Travel Planning
description: 70% of consumers are planning vacations this year. That means a larger audience for our consumers to connect with. Weekend trips or staycations are trending this year likely in more rural or secluded destinations. Now's the time to showcase the value our travel customers have to offer. Why choose their services? Why choose to stay with them rather than a brand they've stayed with before? Look to specific services or details about your travel customers that help them stand out. Also don't be afraid to think outside the box when it comes to travel planning (think boarding pets, vehicle storage, packing tips, or guides to local areas).

name: Hosting From Home
description: While virtual meetups aren't going anywhere, folks are looking forward to hosting close family and friends in the somewhat near future. Think spruced up social spaces, fresh furniture ideas, and tips to get all that clutter under control. People are planning—and purchasing—for their post-quarantine lives. Consider how your customers can help. Think furniture DIY and inspo, potential first meals they'll serve, and outdoor living spaces.

name: Anyone Can Cook
description: Limited dining options and quarantine in 2020 taught many folks how to take the fate of weeknight dinners into their own hands. In 2021, we're seeing the result of millions of home chefs flexing their skills and wanting to push their kitchen-prowess further. From new cookbooks to viral Tik Tok recipes, we'll see the cooking community come together more and more this year. How can you engage with at-home chefs or those looking to expand their palate.

name: Sleep is the New Self-Care
description: From sleep yoga to essential oil blends made for sleep, folks are getting serious about getting some Zzz's. With more emphasis on mental health this year (and the last), sleep is becoming a commodity that cannot be sacrificed. Bedtime routines are become a must-have along with anything that can get you a better night sleep. Think: silk sleep masks, noise machines. a rise in CBD products, and essential oils for bedtime.

name: Backyard Projects
description: Maintaining yards and outdoor spaces during the Summer can be daunting. Many look for inspiration on how to keep their spaces fresh and pest free all season long. Springboard ideas to get you started: Dream garden inspo, patio furniture updates, easy pest control, and tool organization. #backyardreno

name: Meal Prep Comeback
description: During quarantine, many loosened up their strict meal prep routines. However, we're seeing more and more folks ease back into meal prep. At the core of meal prep is the sentiment of being prepped and prepared for the week. How can your customers help consumers achieve this?

name: Everyday Wellness
description: A shift to natural, shorter movement being incorporated throughout the day rather than spending hours in the gym is on the rise. Activities like biking, cleaning, and gardening set a new exercise model for many. Look to promote movement as accessible activities that can be attainably woven through the week.

name: Home offices
description: Looks like remote work is a permanent, accessible solution for many! Home offices are going to be a priority for home buyers.  Think of the educational content your customer could offer about home office design trends -- soothing colors, natural decor, access to sunlight/fresh air,  or even smart tech solutions. Engage with followers by asking your audience to share details about their home office spaces.

name: Best Dressed
description: Loungewear may still reign supreme, but people are planning for future events. Weddings, vacations, casual get-togethers are top-of-mind for many. How can your customer help those planning for their first events post-quarantine? Think retail or businesses in the wedding industry.

name: Curbside Comfort
description: Even as dining restrictions ease in many parts of the US, restaurant goers have learned to love the ease of curbside and to-go dining. While many will return to dining (especially in the summer months), the push for investing in digital experiences within the restaurant industry is here to stay. If curbside pick-up is offered by any of your customers, be sure to promote that aspect of the business as a CTA in your content.

name: Values Matter Most
description: The pandemic has put everyone in touch with what matters. People are more grounded in their values than ever—and they want the world to see it. Does your customer mention any particular values in their welcome call or in their brand kit? Are they passionate about the planet and making eco-conscious decisions? Do they work with the local community in any way to give back?

name: Morning Rituals
description: The time spent at home in the past year has allowed folks to fine-tune their morning routines. With many gaining minutes to hours back in their day from the time not spent commuting, there's been a shift in focus on how to spend the first hours of the day. Breakfast is making a big comeback for many. Morning workouts, mediations, and yoga flows allow folks to start their day with less stress and more focus. Specialty coffee drinks made from an at-home coffee bar have found their place too. Do your health and wellness customers offer online meditations or yoga flows to tune into? Or maybe coffee shops offer a barista class or want to hear about the kinds of drinks folks have been trying to master at home. Think about how your customers can make morning routines that much more enjoyable for consumers.

name: Spicing Up the Pantry
description: 2021 is shaping up to be a flavorful year. Consumers are looking for quick and easy ways to spice up the meals they've been making at home, and stores are seeing a lot of interest in handcrafted shelf-stable sauces and spice blends. Do your restaurant customers offer any dishes that pack a flavorful punch? Or engage followers by asking if they've cooked with any signature spices in popular menu items.

name: The gift of lawn care
description: As we move towards Mother and Father's Day season, here are seven types of people who would love lawn care as a gift: someone in need, the ameteur landscaper, the hard worker, the newbie homeowner, new parents, someone selling their home, and the person who has everything.

name: Home Rescue
description: Flooding often happens this time of the year. When homes are damaged and flooded, damage restoration crews are the folks to call. Does your customer offer warranties on their services?

name: Energy Conscious
description: Over the years, using solar energy in the home has not only become more popular, but more affordable. Installing solar panels in the spring is a great way to prepare for the sunny summer months.

name: Work From Home Needs
description: As many folks have shifted to working from home, they're looking to upgrade their internet or running new lines to home offices.

name: Wall-To-Wall Cabinetry
description: Kitchens are seeing more use after the last year, filling with gadgets and tools to help with at-home meals. This year, we're seeing a shift to wall-to-wall cabinetry instead of smaller units of open shelving or cluttered countertops.

name: Open-concept floor plans may be on the decline
description: People are looking for ways to create a little personal space within their homes. Room dividers, using shelving to break up open space, creating at-home offices in unique ways, the open floor plan doesn't provide the privacy we need when spending more time at home. This content would work best for customers looking to explore trends in this industry or give tips on how to define spaces with furniture in an open-concept living space. #openconceptliving

name: Home Projects and ROI
description: Some folks may be hesitant to invest in an DIY project or home reno. Remodeling projects with the highest ROI include minor bathroom remodel, landscaping, minor kitchen remodel, and many others.

name: Remodeling Tip
description: Remodeling a home isn't for the faint of heart. It's recommended to budget a 10% cushion into your project if you're living in the home while remodeling and 30% if you plan to live elsewhere to account for delays or mishaps during construction.

name: Solid vs. Engineered Hardwood
description: Solid hardwood flooring typically comes in long planks, milled with tongues and grooves on opposite edges so that the boards interlock when installed. It is always nailed down to the subfloor, a process that requires some skill. Because it is solid wood, this flooring can be sanded down and refinished several times over its life. Engineered flooring looks like solid hardwood, but it's made of a thin layer of hardwood bonded over a premium-quality plywood layer for added stability. It is both less expensive and easier for DIYers to install than solid hardwood. Solid hardwood vs engineered hardwood is a great topic to engage audiences — especially those looking to renovate or flip a new home.

name: Remodeling Projects
description: Lots of people jump into remodel-mode in the spring once the weather warms up. Contractors are needed to help plan new construction or larger remodeling projects to make sure all the right people get brought and to help estimate cost.

name: Home Refresh
description: Hiring a painting contractor is often needed for renovation projects that cover large parts of the home, high ceilings, or even where drywall has been repaired to match paint. Does your customer offer special services for repairs, or have specialty like cabinetry or exterior wall paint?

name: Home Reno
description: Whether it's installing a pool in preparation of summer or smoothing out damaged parts of the property from fallen trees and debris, if there's dirt to be moved, Excavation Contractors are here to help. Spring is the perfect time to install a swimming pool. Check to see if your customer has any specializations or specialty equipment that could help.

name: Home Customization
description: Folks who are building homes this spring may have the opportunity to look into customizing their driveway.

name: Outdoor Living Upgrade
description: Getting ready for poolside dinners and days spent outside is the perfect opportunity to refresh outdoor living spaces — that's where our outdoor lighting customers come in. Pool lighting, advanced lighting system in gardens and yards, and professionally lit gazebos are all on the top of mind over the next few months.

name: Home Staging
description: Staging a home can drastically improve the rate at which it sells. It's important to keep in mind those carpets that have been walked on for over a decade or the rug under the dining table that doesn't get a deep clean all the time. Carpet cleaning is a great way to remove dust, dirt, build-up, and improve the air quality in a home. Some companies offer free estimates which is great for home owners working on a budget.

name: Curb Appeal
description: Curb appeal is a big deal when it comes to selling your home. Hiring a company to pressure wash the driveway and sidewalks of a home before it gets put on the market is an easy way to elevate the look and feel without doing any major renovation.
subvertical: Cleaning Services, Power and Pressure Washing

name: Unseen Issues in Old Homes
description: Older homes have their charm, but also can come with unseen issues. Depending on the age of the property, the chimney might be outdated compared to the rest of the home. An expert will know techniques to repair older and newer chimneys.

name: A Helpful Hand
description: Some small fixes are often needed before you close on a house. From switching light fixtures to fixing a leaky toilet, a handyman is perfect to call when there are multiple small fixes that need to get done quickly rather than calling multiple contractors.

name: Renovations
description: Smaller renovation and remodel projects may be doable on your own, but when trying to move or replace light fixtures it's important to have a professional to avoid costly mistakes.

name: Clean-Lined Cabinets
description: While trends overall are leaning away from minimalism, cabinetry is an exception. More and more homes are opting for more modern cabinets in kitchen and bathrooms instead of a more traditional style.

name: Thoughtful organization of decor
description: We're seeing a shift away from minimalism folks spending more time in their homes. They're realizing rather than being tucked away in a drawer or closet, having the things they need within arms reach is important. This leads to careful curation of how these items are displayed: think curio cabinets or shelving with glass doors and carefully curated shelves in kitchens, offices, and living spaces. Useful for customers who offer staging as a part of their realty service or in educational posts about interior design trends. #shelfie

name: Shifts to neutrals and warm colors
description: Warm neutrals are on the rise. Cool tones aren't completely going away, but tones that are inviting and cozy are certainly making an entrance. Think natural feeling spaces over sleek and minimal. Useful for customers who offer staging as a part of their realty service, educational posts about interior design trends, audience participation posts about color palettes in the home

name: Organization as a viral trend
description: Pairing nicely with seasonal spring cleaning, projects that include organizing drawers, shelves, cabinets, and closets are making the rounds. Folks love the gratification of a clean and tidy space. More examples include: pantries, offices, bookshelves, garages, and bathrooms. This content compliments posts about decluttering and improving the appeal of a home before it goes on the market. #organized, #pantrymakeover, #declutter, #homeorganization

name: Pest Control in the Kitchen
description: Spring pests, like ants, love kitchen spaces because of the availability of potential water and food sources. Crumbs, spill residue, and food left out are some of their favorite snacks.

name: Pests That Thrive in the Summer
description: Mosquitoes, Ants, Fleas, Ticks, Termites, Grasshoppers, Flies, and Stinging Insects

name: Custom-built homes
description: With real estate prices in many areas going up, some people are considering custom-built homes. For many, the long-term cost savings of buying a new home are more attractive than maintaining an older home.

name: Pool maintenance
description: With summer coming, it's important to make sure your pool continues to operate successfully. Skimming, brushing, and vacuuming your pool are just a few things to keep track of when considering pool maintenance. Making sure chemical levels stay where they need to be can take a little more time and practice. Some pool companies offer routine in-person maintenance, while others may provide the perfect tools to do it yourself.

name: Gutter cleaning
description: Depending on where you live and if there are trees near your home, you need to make sure your gutters are clear of debris. Having clear gutters insures rainwater flows freely and does not get stuck which can cause standing water. This can cause a number of problems including damage to the gutter itself, excess moisture in walls, mold and mildew. Most roofing or handyman companies can safely and effectively clear gutters prior to unpredictable weather.

name: New construction plumbing
description: The housing market means an influx of new homes needing plumbing installation or updates/repairs to older plumbing in a newly-purchased home. Does your customer offer new installation warranties or discounts?

name: Slim Pickings
description: From late 2020 to mid 2021, real estate inventory has been incredibly low. As of November 2020, inventory has been down a whole 20%. In December, more that 70% of homes for sale were on the market for less than a month. Simply put, in some markets, there aren't enough houses to meet buyer demand. For buyers, low inventory means: moving faster, expanding the search geographically, and considering what things are "must haves" vs. "nice to haves." It's a great idea to get pre-approved ASAP and find less expensive homes in great neighborhoods in they can afford to upgrade over time. For sellers, this is better news: Low inventory means less selling competition.

name: Rising home prices
description: As of the end of last year, existing home prices had grown by about 15% as compared to the same time the prior year. This marked more than 100 straight months of consistent price gains. Encourage your audience to really know what they can afford. It could be time to post some budgeting tips for buyers, like: limiting their house payment to no more than a specified percentage of their take-home pay, saving up to make  a down payment, etc. Remember: Avoid specific numbers or percentages within content. We should never be giving specific financial advice on behalf of our customers.

name: Low Mortgage Interest Rates
description: Mortgage interest rates, the fees that lenders charge as a percentage of a loan amount, are the lowest they've been in decades (around 3%), and economists think that this trend should continue through 2021. For buyers, this can help with affordability, but they should be cautious as to not purchase a home they cannot afford. For sellers, this means that buyers might be motivated to purchase their properties sooner.

name: The Rise of Millennials
description: No longer just in the "entry-level" market, millennials are moving into and taking over the "move-up" market, as they grow their families and need more space. Consider the age of your audience when creating content. Older millennials in some places may be ready to move on from their starter homes into bigger properties with more space and resources.

name: Suburban migration
description: People are moving into the suburbs! With permanent remote work becoming more common, city-dwellers —freed from the daily tether of a commute to the office and looking for affordable space to shelter, work, learn, and live— are finding homing solutions outside of their typical urban communities. Even before the pandemic, homebuyers looking for affordability were drawn to these areas, too. This is a great trend to capitalize on if you have any Realtor clients who work in areas or communities that are adjacent to large, bustling urban sprawls. Highlight the benefits of those communities!

name: 3D printed homes
description: 3D printed homes are gaining popularity as they become more easily available in cities across the country. They can typically be built quickly and at a lower price than a traditional home. An interesting trend can make for a great audience participation post.

name: Natural mosquito control
description: Mosquito and other pest control using natural ingredients like plant oils are gaining in popularity. Additionally, making changes to your outdoor area like treating water features with repellent or working to remedy areas with standing water can be a big help. Mosquitoes thrive in hot, humid weather. Natural alternatives are popular because they are effective and safe for children and pets.

name: Drywall installation
description: Drywall installation is one of the most commonly requested handyman services, home improvement or to repair damage. Professionals can repair or install drywall including cracks from settling, wear and tear, moisture damage, rodent damage, drywall hanging, and painting and finishing touches.

name: Above Asking Price
description: The asking price for a home is the amount of money that the seller wishes to receive for their property. Due to lower inventory and higher demand, nearly every home sold during the pandemic went into a multiple-offer situation. Thus, a majority of recent buyers have had to pay over the asking price for their new home purchases. This particularly impacted first-time home buyers and millenials, who tended to have lower budgets.

name: Required renovations
description: Due to lower inventory and higher demand, many buyers have had to settle for properties that need more work or repairs than they had originally planned or budgeted for. According to a survey, 56% of millennials bought a home requiring minor or major renovations, although only 42.4% began their search with that intention. If your client has connections to contractors, remodelers, interior designers, etc -- highlight that! Also, this is a good time to post home-improvement tips, DIY projects, design trends and suggestions, and the like.

name: Playful details
description: Due to budget or time constraints, making major aesthetic overhauls may be a difficulty or impossibility for some buyers. Small details, such as dashes of color, backsplashes, or unique hardware on cabinets or drawers are small,simple details that make big impacts. For audience participation, you can ask your clients' audience what their favorite small details in their home are. Alternatively, you can choose a stock photo that shows off a small detail and highlight this idea in the caption.

name: Vegetable gardens
description: As people became wary of the grocery store in the beginning of the pandemic, at-home vegetable gardens grew (haha) in popularity. Expect to see these new gardeners keep at it as the late spring/early summer harvest season approaches.  Post gardening tips or recipes for seasonal fruits and veggies. Highlight veggie and fruit plants that look beautiful as a way to impress potential buyers and boost curb appeal.

name: DIY playgrounds
description: Since many people spent most of their time at home last year, they invested in backyard entertainment to keep their families busy. Think inflatable pools, swing sets, rope swings, and lawn games like cornhole. These inexpensive improvements can bring a lot of life into an otherwise unimpressive backyard space.  Highlight ways to affordably and efficiently turn a backyard into a fun place the whole family can enjoy.

name: New construction
description: Since inventory in the housing market is low, more buyers may be turning to new construction as a solution. Basically, this term refers to buying a house before it is complete or built. This process comes with its own set of complications, like securing permits, finding contractors, and more.  Also, as a result, the buyer may have more influence on what the finished product looks like,

name: Housing Market
description: The spring & summer months are typically the busiest time of the year for real estate professional. Homeowners looking to sell may be finishing up renovations or looking for agents to get their houses on the market. Scoping out rental properties is common during this time of year, too. People use these months as an opportunity to check out new neighborhoods and parks, too -- the warmer weather makes strolls, walks, and other realty recon more enjoyable.

name: Curb appeal
description: Sprucing up curb appeal is a traditional seasonal real estate marketing technique. A home's "curb appeal" is the first impression it gives to the outside world. It enhances the overall look and feel of a property, and it also stimulates interest and provides a return on investment. Think of all the things you see when you stand in front of a home -- the driveway, the door, the front yard, etc. In general, touching up or enhancing these things adds to curb appeal. You could even post gardening tips or wreath examples.

name: Backyard Trends
description: In the summer months, backyards can really stand out. They're defining features of the home and could lead potential buyers into thinking how to live their lives outdoors. Lately, people have been improving their backyards with particular attention paid to sustainability, "gardening with a purpose" (using native/local or functional plants, etc), and moving indoor living outside.

name: Summer housing market update
description: July is typically the last big push for sellers before the slower season starts in August. Due to the lower inventory and higher prices of homes this year, we may not see as big of a dip as previous years.

name: Home improvement budgets
description: According to the 10th annual Houzz & Home report, which polled more than 70,000 respondents on their renovation habits, our home improvement budgets ballooned by 15% over the past year—up to a median of $15,000 per household. Essentially, those who had renovations in mind had the time to complete those remodels this year. Additionally, people report having their hearts set on renovating even more as 2021 continues.

name: Garden and deck improvements
description: Demand for outdoor renovation projects has went up, probably because people are realizing that they're using their yards now more than ever. What may have resulted in small DIY projects in years past has blossomed into complete deck and porch redos. Use this as an opportunity to point out cool outdoor features, suggest upgrades to homeowners, and to let those in the market know what to look for.

name: Smart home upgrades
description: Homeowners are moving away from cineplex entertainment centers and towards smart home integration. Applicable devices include streaming platforms, TVs, light fixtures, speakers, sound systems, and more. There's limitless potential -- highlight potential smart upgrades in ongoing content.

name: Simple & budget-friendly garden renovations
description: Fixing up an outdoor space doesn't need to be a huge financial commitment. Here are some fun, and affordable, weighs to upgrade a back or front yard: 1) Define your spaces. Clearly defined spaces give backyards dimension and purpose. Experts suggest adding tables, chairs, and outdoor rugs to assist with this goal. 2) Create a garden path. Adding a meandering path gives a polished look to a seemingly untamed space. You can accomplish this by freeing existing stones of weeds or overgrowth, or lay a new path with gravel, paverr, or concrete stones. 3) Think vertically. Add some vertical elements, like a chiminea, to your backyard to switch up a flat perspective. They can serve to add dimension and color.

name: Green Features
description: People are paying attention to the environment when looking for their next home. Aside from the obvious climate-related benefits, these feature may also make a home cheaper to maintain -- lower energy costs, etc. Here are some common features that may be present in newly-constructed residential properties: improved insulation, programmable thermostats, low-emittance windows, energy-efficient lighting, sustainable building materials, solar or geothermal energy sources, and more.

name: National Water Quality Month
description: National Water Quality Month in August is all about protecting our water resources and educating ourselves about water quality. The average person uses approximately 80 gallons of water or more per day!

name: Heat wave
description: A heat wave is a period of excessively hot weather, which may be accompanied by high humidity, especially in oceanic climate countries. They are usually measured relative to the usual weather in a given season and area.

name: Forgoing a home inspection
description: Given a competitive housing market, some buyers are offering to forgo a home inspection when putting in an offer. While this may increase your chances of getting the home, it is generally not recommended by home inspectors or Realtors.

name: Indoor air quality
description: IAQ refers to the air quality within and around buildings and structures, especially as it relates to the health and comfort of building occupants. This has especially become a hot topic due to COVID-19.

name: Decluttering
description: Clutter can make homes hard to stage, and it also can make it more difficult to move when the time comes. Encourage your audience to take note of what they're hoarding and encouraging freeing up space. Commonly collecting items include coffee mugs, tote bags, tupperware and dishes, and more.

name: Adjustable-rate mortgages
description: Due to record-high home prices, more buyers than ever are choosing to go with adjustable-rate mortgages, which offer lower monthly payments initially. People are looking to save money on monthly payments by any means possible. However, the mortgage rate on these types of loans reset after a set amount of years -- usually five or ten. If rates go down by that time, that's a good thing for the buyer. However, if rates go up, their monthly payments will increase to reflect the market at that time. Since mortgage rates are historically low right now, making this choice could saddle buyers with higher payments in the future. It's a risk, but it's one that could pay off if the buyer intends to sell their home after the initial period elapses.

name: Getting spooky in the suburbs?
description: Black-painted homes have long been trendy in urban areas, but now we're seeing this edgy trend start to pop up in suburbs across the country. Black houses do look stylish and can create some unique curb appeal -- they certainly stand out, especially in suburban areas. It's important to consider the type of architecture before taking this aesthetic step -- darker hues look great on houses with barn-like exteriors, but may look strange on more intricate homes. Black or dark hues can also play a supporting role in a color story instead of standing is as the main character. Black houses also may incur higher energy costs because they attract heat. In any case, this is an idea that people are sure to have opinions on.  Try posting a stock image of a beautiful black home, ask what people think, and let your audience sound off in the comments.

name: Victory gardens
description: Small vegetable gardens, called Victory gardens, first became popular during WW1 because citizens were encouraged to grow food wherever they could. This trend resurged during the pandemic as more American became faced with food insecurity or were unable to make grocery trips. Now, people have learned to enjoy the self-sufficiency that a small garden can bring. Posting about the history of Victory gardens, educational tips about what's in season or how to grow different things, or even #goals garden examples can be a fun way to draw in an audience.

name: Shortage of starter homes
description: Millennials are having trouble getting into the housing market -- it may seem as if everything is on hold. Traditionally, smaller homes with lower selling prices have served as the first rung on the homeownership ladder. However, the supply ot "entry-level" housing is the lowest it's been in fifty years. As we know, demand is high and inventory is low. For young homeowners, it might be necessary to expand the geographical bounds of their searches or to look at less-desirable homes, like fixer-uppers and foreclosures.

name: College-town investments
description: When colleges transitioned to remote learning, it created a lot of housing vacancies in traditionally affluent, competitive college town markets. Now that most colleges plan on resuming in-person learning in fall due to widespread vaccine availability, that window of investment opportunity is getting smaller -- but it's still there. If you're considering investing in a college-town market, it can be important to track things like available on-campus housing vs. total enrollment, job markets, and cost of living. In general, smaller cities are safe bets.

name: Large-format tile
description: Visual and aesthetic upgrades are a huge part of home renovations trends. Larger tiles help to visually expand a smaller space. Additionally, there's less grout, which means that there's less to clean and less visual clutter. Matte tiles are great for bathroom floors because they add grip and provide slip resistance.

name: Cohesive colors
description: Color palates are personal, and not everyone likes the same thing. Sellers shouldn't be afraid to express their tastes through paint and color, but here are some tips to avoid a choppy, dissonant experience for potential buyers: 1) Pick a flow-through paint. This means choose a consistent paint color for the walls of connecting spaces to create a cohesive feel. The foyer, hallway, and main connectors should ass be the same color. 2) Think about sightlines. This term refers to the walls in other rooms you may see while standing in one room. The colors on these different walls need to go together so they don't clash. 3) Choose color groups. A simple way to avoid clashing color schemes is to stick to the same color-temperature family -- warms or cools, but not both. 4) Restrict edgier colors to closed-off rooms. Rooms that are out of the sightline of other spaces are a good place to go wild with color, if you're so inclined. Think Master bedrooms, kids rooms, powder rooms, etc. 5) Emphasize with accessories. There are ways to inject bold colors that aren't the main focus of the room. That way, it's less jarring and easier to swap out for a different aesthetic at any time.

name: Lumber prices
description: After rising to higher than normal levels in Spring 2021, the cost of lumber has been falling since July. Wood prices have plunged back to levels resembling those before lockdowns cut supplies short and boosted demand. While this is a positive change for builders and DIY-ers, experts say not to expect the cost of new houses to decrease along with the price of lumber.

name: Existing home sales have rebounded
description: Though the recound wasn't as large as economists expected, the percentage of existing home sales rose 1.4% after months of decline. Also, the median sales price of existing homes has risen significantly (23.4%) year-over-year to a record of $363,000. Tight inventories and high prices remain a challenge, but supply is gradually moving up.

name: Top housing markets
description: Economists have identified the top markets for buyers and investors in the second quarter of this year. Smaller, more affordable markets rose to the top of the list -- places that have strong local economies, lower costs of living, and where buyers can get more space for their money. Billings, MT was toward the top of the list due to recent jumps in listing prices that are expected to continue rising, the state's oil business hb, and the lower cost of living. Other places, like Fort Wayne, ID, have risen toward the top because they serve as alternatives to midsize cities. Waco, TX, Portland, ME, and Raleigh, NC also rose as standouts.

name: Let the light in
description: Buyers love homes that are spacious, bright, and inviting. Inviting natural light into your home is a great way to catch the eye of potential buyers and increase your home's value. Try thinning out rooms by removing excess furniture, opening all the blinds, and removing dark solar screens or curtains before you next open house or showing.

name: From the ground up
description: When preparing to sell your home, consider removing any carpeting and replacing the floor with wood, laminate, or tile flooring. Old carpeting is an instant turn-off to prospective buyers. Additionally, carpeting is harder to maintain and keep clean than other types of flooring, so resist the temptation to replace older carpet with new carpet. It's hard to maintain, so investing in alternative forms or flooring is money well spent.

name: Storage solutions
description: Storage is always a bonus for buyers -- especially in rooms where people may need to stash blankets, electronics, or toys. Adding built-in shelving in areas with interesting angles or niches can add interest and function to a room. Show off unique storage options to your audience, or consider creating educational posts with regards to where extra storage opportunities exist (under the stairs, etc.).

name: New home updates
description: Home construction has continues to improve after the dip in the last quarter, but home builders are still being faced with challenges, including a lack of labor and building materials. These lacks have driven the costs of building new homes up. The factors that have increased demand for new homes still haven't lapsed -- there's still a high demand and low inventory. However, rising prices and general stress have caused some buyers to halt their search for the time being. The next step for the market will be determined by the paths the builders take -- they can ramp up inventory and pass lower prices onto their consumers, or take advantage of the opportunity to offset last year's setbacks and boost profits.

name: Unpacking tips
description: Congrats! You've found a new home. Moving can be daunting, and unpacking -- even more so. Here are some tips for how to streamline the process: 1) Move room by room, and start with the essentials. Instead of unpacking a little here and there, it'll feel much better to have one room fully unpacked than a few that are partially done. Pack essentials like bedding, toiletries, and medications in ways that are easily accessible. 2) Keep purging as you unpack. Presumably, you got rid of unwanted or unnecessary items while you packed. However, while you're unpacking, be ruthless. Set aside a box to collect extraneous belongings for donation while you are in the unpacking process.  3) Use lists! It's likely that things will be arranged differently in your new home than your last one. Tape lists of their contents outside of each drawer or cabinet until you become familiarized with what's inside.

name: Rent prices skyrocket
description: The low inventory, high demand housing market is affecting more than just buyers. Rentals are becoming more competitive, too. Most properties are receiving more applications than before -- up to five times the amount they would have received just a year ago. Smaller cities are seeing the biggest spike in rental properties -- these smaller areas outside of larger cities became especially attractive during the pandemic.

name: Different types of roofing
description: Depending on the climate where you live and budget, a certain type of roof may be more advantageous than others. If you need to repair part of your roof or re-do the entire thing, talk with your local roofing company about your options.

name: Clean energy
description: Clean energy was second-most prevalent US electricity source in 2020. Solar is the best way for common homeowners to utilize clean, renewable energy.

name: Renovating your home one room at a time
description: You don't have to do everything all at once. With budget and time top-of-mind, you can update your home slowly, prioritizing what's most important to you.

name: FHA loans
description: A US Federal Housing Administration mortgage insurance-backed mortgage loan that is provided by an FHA-approved lender. Historically, they've allowed Americans with lower income or credit scores to borrow money to purchase a home.

name: Homebuying timeline
description: The shopping phase along can take anywhere from 3-6 months. On average, it takes 30-45 days to close on a home once you are under contract.

name: Mosquito Season
description: Depending on where you live, it might be peak mosquito season in your state. Ouch! Mosquitos thrive when the heather is the hottest -- here are some simple ways to help keep those pests at bay: 1) Eliminate standing water around your home. 2) Move Potted plants indoors. 3) Plant and grow insect-repellent plants, like lemon balm, mint, basil, or rosemary. 4) Hire a professional to treat your yard. If you have pets or young children, consider choosing an organic, nontoxic treatment option.

name: Summer comfort
description: Temperatures, and electricity bills, reach new heights as summer peaks and comes to a close. Here are some ways to conserve energy: 1) Replace your inefficient air conditioner. Installing new, energy-efficient models is the best way to cut costs. 2) Weatherproof your home. To ensure your cool air isn't leaking into the atmosphere, ensure that your doors and windows are sealed properly. 3). Turn off and unplug appliances when they're not in use. 8) Wash your clothes in warm or cold water rather than hot. Line dry your clothes when you can.

name: DIY vs. Ask for help
description: There are lots of things to consider when you're thinking about remodeling a part of your home, and perhaps the first decision to make is to whether to tackle the project alone or hire a professional. If you have comprehensive remodels in mind, it's best to entrust the job to someone who knows what they're doing. Small renovations, like refreshing paint or installing new faucets, can easily be done on our own. Always leave flooring and plumbing work to the experts.

name: Remodel your bathroom on a budget
description: Even if you are making the wise decision to hire outside help to complete your remodels, there are a few things you can do to keep costs down: 1) Buy your own fixtures. This ensures you get exactly what you want and you can stay within the price range you had in mind.2) Keep the existing footprint. Moving entire main fixtures, like the toilet sink or bathtub, requires expensive re-routing of water supplies, waste lines, electrical outlets, and more. Instead, consider refreshing the aesthetic instead of the arrangement. 3) Install your own mirror. The hardware to do this typically costs less than 50 dollars.Look for a professional only if the mirror is too heavy or large to take on yourself.

name: Laminate vs. vinyl flooring
description: What even is the difference? If you're concerned about the total cost or the environment, laminate is probably a better option. If you're considered about durability, moisture/water, resale value, or bet, you would benefit from choosing a luxury vinyl option. Both do look synthetic, because they are, but the final result is polished and professional.

name: Marble vs. granite
description: Marble and granite are both popular home renovation materials that add elegance and value to your property. Whether you’re installing a new bathroom floor or replacing your kitchen countertops, these natural stones are both great choices. If you're going for a more luxurious appearance, marble is the superior choice. It's elegant, timeless, and pairs well with a variety of aesthetic themes. If cost is on your mind, go with granite. It's cheaper than marble, comes in more color options, and still looks luxurious. Granite is easier to take care of -- it can be cleaned with mild detergent and hot water, disinfected easily, and kept stain-free with the right precautions (oil-based liquids will stain it, though). Marble, on the other hand, is more prone to staining. Granite is also stronger and will resist chipping, scratching, and cracking better than marble will. Consider choosing granite for higher-traffic areas.Both materials will and do require maintenance and occasional repair.

name: Water pressure
description: If you realize after testing your shower water pressure that the issue is isolated to one shower in your home, you might be able to fix the problem on your own. Here are some things to try: 1) Consider cleaning your shower aerator by soaking it in a cleaning agent like vinegar. 2) Replace your shower head with a new model. 3) Check your pipes. 4) Purchase and Install a water pressure booster. 5) Call your city's water department to ensure it's not a municipal issue.

name: Latest design trends
description: After this year, it's understandable that people have been spending a ton of time at home and decorating up a storm to make their homes more versatile and functional than ever before. Here are some new trends we've been seeing a lot of: 1)Rooms for specific activities. We've gone beyond the home office. People have taken to centering rooms around their favorite hobbies -- from crafting, to theaters, gyms, and more. Ask you audience what their "dream room" would be! 2) Go green! The color, that is -- green cabinets, tiles, and more have become popular lately. 3) Luxe materials. Homeowners have been grabbing at opportunities to make their living spaces more "glam." We've seen gold accents, velvet touches, and other luxe materials pop up more and more lately.

name: Something's going on in the suburbs
description: As Covid-19 progressed, we saw many move away from cities and into suburbs.. This made prices of suburban homes skyrocket -- the outer suburbs, known as the "exurbs" saw extreme increase.  But will those values stay in the stratosphere? Well, the future remains uncertain. Many remote workers may have to return to the office at least a few days a week, and this makes commuting more relevant again. And historically, exurbs have been more vulnerable to downturns-- these areas could find themselves competing with the appeal of urban life again.

name: Good news for homebuyers
description: Finally! According to economists, the latest home economic trends have shown an increase in affordable homes listed for sale as well as a slowdown in price appreciation. This news could definitely offer some relief to stressed-out homebuyers who have been on the search for a while now.

name: Home-sale secrets
description: Here are some tips seldom mentioned in listing houses that might make your property stand out: 1) Think about your curb appeal. From the mailbox to the front door, it all matters. 2) Restage your rooms to reflect their original purpose. 3) Provide insider information, like your favorite local restaurant, libraries, etc. 4). Describe the neighborhood culture. 5) Create a video tour. 6) Get a home pre-inspection.

name: Back to school
description: Fall is quickly approaching! Does your Realtor client take pride in the school district they sell in? Now's the time to mention it.

name: Virtual staging tips
description: When it comes to photographing your house, more is more. Take multiple photos of every shot. Later, you'll have plenty of time to go through the images and choose the best ones.If you've done significant remodels, consider including before/after shots.

name: Chimney Safety Week
description: The week before Fire Safety Week (10/3-10/9 in 2021). This observance aims to reach and teach people about chimney and venting safety.

name: National Construction Appreciation Week
description: This is observed during the third week in September and recognizes the dedicated, hard-working people who are instrumental in the development of our infrastructure.

name: National Fall Foliage Week
description: Beginning on the last Sunday in September, this week celebrates the fact that Autumn is right around the corner. Moderate temperatures, holidays, and beautiful changing leaves!

name: Types of water heaters
description: Conventional tank water heaters store hot water in a large tank 24 hours a day, while tankless water heaters are compact units that provide hot water as it is needed.

name: What's Old is New Again
description: It's always fun to watch seemingly dated trends re-emerge! Here are five surprisingly eye-catching trends that are making a comeback: 1) Subway tile with thin grout lines. Antique subway tile is square, perfectly, flat, and is a great way to add some 1920s charm to any home. 2) Thin-plank hardwood flooring. Today, wider planks are more popular, but using thin planks adds an air of expense and sophistication. 3) Interior shutters. Curtains aren't the only option! 4). Vintage appliances. They can add a kitschy, fun, and unique original look to a kitchen. 5). Colorful bathrooms. The bathroom, which is traditionally out of sight, is a fun space to move beyond neutrals and consider adding a splash of vibrancy.

name: Pros and Cons of Buying a Home Near a School
description: Thinking of moving your family into a new home? If you want to avoid the double commute and trust your kids to walk themselves to school, it's a good idea to choose a home that's close to their place of education. Also, safety is often a priority in and around schools and the neighborhoods that are nearby. Owning a home near a school can improve its resale value, too. However, living near schools can sometimes mean living near heavy traffic, as other parents who don't live nearby will likely be dropping their kids off, attending sports games, etc. Noise may be higher in these areas, and privacy can be limited,  too.

name: Renting vs. Buying
description: It's an age-old question: "Should I continue to rent, or should I make strides toward purchasing a home?" Here are a few questions your customer's clients can ask themselves to help reach an answer: 1) "Will I qualify for a mortgage, and what can I afford?" Encourage your clients' audience to try a rent vs. buy calculator. 2) "Can I afford closing costs?" A home purchase includes more than just a down payment. Closing costs can add up to 3% or more of the total price. Make sure they consider everything. 3) "Can I afford this neighborhood?" Make sure your clients don't overlook taxes, HOAs, and other things when determining their desired area. 4). "Can I take on the maintenance?" No more landlord means things like plumbing, electrical, and construction issues are now your client's responsibility. Ask your clients if they have the time and funds to take care of the accessory costs and repairs.

name: Latest Housing Data Trends
description: Home sales increased across July, with regards to both new and existing homes. Median home sales prices continued to increase. The costs of new homes is currently at a record high. Mortgage rates have remained the same for the past month. Options remain scarce -- fewer new listings have hit the market now as compared to the last six weeks.

name: Rental Rates Go Up
description: Rental data shows recent growth, as rental rates across the country continue to skyrocket. Even though median home prices are at a high, too, it could be a good time to think about purchasing if you have the savings for a down payment and closing costs. Month-to-month, a mortgage might be cheaper than renting.

name: Common Pitfalls for First-time Homebuyers
description: Owning your first home is a learning experience! That said, there are some common missteps that are easy to avoid. Always ask for recommendations when hiring contractors and other maintenance workers. Budget for new and unexpected expenses. Avoid making home improvements right away, too. After you've lived in a space for a few months, you'll have a clearer idea of how you want to use each room.

name: Extreme Weather
description: Hurricanes. Heat waves. Earthquakes. Tornadoes. The headlines are awash with extreme weather reports, and the damage from these disasters is impossible to ignore. Always encourage your audience to expect the unexpected and prepare themselves by considering the location of their potential homes, making sure they have adequate disaster insurance, etc. Some of these damages are covered by standard insurance, but some, like flooding and earthquakes, are not. Be aware of what to look for!

name: Should Sellers Always Pick the Highest Offer?
description: Owning your first home is a learning experience! That said, there are some common missteps that are easy to avoid. Always ask for recommendations when hiring contractors and other maintenance workers. Budget for new and unexpected expenses. Avoid making home improvements right away, too. After you've lived in a space for a few months, you'll have a clearer idea of how you want to use each room.

name: Family-friendly Suburbs
description: According to a list published on realtor.com, families may want to consider looking to buy in these areas that surround major cities like NYC, Los Angeles, Dallas, Houston, CHicago, and more: Denville in NJ, El Monte in CA, Libertyville in IL, Coppell in TX, Tomball in TX, Exton in PA, Olney in MD, Burlington in MA, Walnut Creek in CA, Peachtree City in GA, and Pembroke Pines in FL.

name: National Fire Prevention Month
description: October is National Fire Prevention Month and that means it’s time for us all to take the precautionary steps to prevent dangerous and life-threatening fires.

name: National Kitchen & Bath Month
description: National Kitchen & Bath Month is an annual designation observed in October. This month, have some fun redecorating some of the most utilized rooms in your home!

name: National Toilet Tank Repair Month
description: National Toilet Tank Repair Month is an annual designation observed in October. The Environmental Protection Agency says a leaking toilet wastes about 200 gallons of water a day

name: October Birth Flowers
description: Marigolds and Cosmos are October's birth flowers.

name: Mortgage rates
description: Mortgage rates have risen by one basis point this week, but they've been fairly flat for the past month. Steady rates mean that it'll be easier for buyers to predict their monthly payments will be for a home purchase prices. Lower rates also offer opportunities for current owners to refinance.

name: Housing market update
description: Homes are continuing to sale quickly and for higher prices, as the number of available homes remains limited. In the past week, the amount of homeowners listing a property has dropped by eight percent.since this time last year.

name: Earth tones for fall
description: This season, we're seeing warm-toned browns, taupes, and greens re-emerge as popular interior design choices. Earth tones can make any space feel cozier, jus in time for the temperature dip in fall.

name: The '70s are back!
description: Interior design trends tend to follow those of fashion, so it's no surprise that we're seeing a '70s influence within the home. Wavy, warm paint colors and designs are in vogue again, as well as funky furniture, earthy color schemes, and rattan accents.

name: Move to matte
description: Shine is out; matte is in. Shiny metals, like chrome, have been popular for a while, but lately, more folks are choosing matte finishes for things like appliances and fixtures. Dark matte finishes create an expensive, luxurious feel without the need for total renovation.

name: Plaid perfection
description: Fall is plaid season -- everyone knows that. Here are some ways to take that classic pattern beyond your favorite flannel and into your home: 1) Plaid accent furniture pieces, like upholstered chairs, add coziness to any room. 2) If you feel bold, go big! Rooms can handle large plaid pieces, like sofas or curtains, if the rest of the room is decorated simply with complementary colors. 3) If subtlety is more your vibe, try choosing plaid pieces in neutral tones, like tans and beiges.

name: Home security
description: With Halloween and holidays coming up, the security of your home has never been more important. Popular companies like Vivint, SimpliSafe, Cove, Ring, and ADT all offer security systems, so it's important to utilize what works best for you.
subvertical: Construction, Handyman, Home Inspection, Windows and Doors, Locksmith

name: Pest control for fall/winter
description: As temperatures begin to fall, it is common to see an increase in rodents and other pests inside the home. Get ahead of them with pest control and rodent mitigation.

name: Home insulation
description: Insulation can save homeowners money on energy costs and help keep their homes comfortable. There are a few different types of insulation based on the space and specific needs. Types include blanket, concrete block, loose fill, and fiber.

name: Snow removal
description: Snow removal is an important service offered by landscape/lawn care companies. Services include de-icing, snow blowing, shoveling, etc. Snow removal is a frequent fall/winter need. Some states have recorded snowfalls as early as September!

name: Home Prices Still Rising
description: Home prices in virtually every major metropolitan area have hit a new high nationwide. Over the last year, the rise in prices have been nearly 20%. This draws comparison to the pre-bust statistics of the early-to-mid 200s, but not to worry! Now, the market is rooted in different, and less dangerous, fundamentals. Home prices are rising now due to low supply and high demand, and thus high competition -- it's still a good time to invest if clients can afford it.

name: Why Should I Hire a Real Estate Agent?
description: It might be tempting to sell your home yourself and pocket the cash you would have paid a professional, especially in the hot current market. However, most times this ends up being a huge waste of time and money for the homeowner. That said, take the care to hire a real estate agent who is knowledgeable about your specific market and demographic. Don't be afraid to talk to a few before making a final choice. Their insight, connections, and advice wll be invaluable.

name: Consider Curb Appeal
description: We've said this before and we'll say it again -- people DO judge books by their covers. You want to make sure your first impression on a potential buyer is a good one. Invest a little time and money in relatively easy fixes, like planting flowers, replacing your front door, and more. It'll be worth it in the end.

name: Less is More
description: When preparing to sell, make sure to declutter your living areas. Do a complete clean sweep of counters, windowsills, tables, closets, drawers, cupboards, and more -- nothing is off limits to potential buyers. If there's a lot of clutter and extra things around your home, it might make your buyers think there's a lack of storage space. Plus, deculttering before a sale will make things much easier when it's time to move.

name: Details Matter
description: When showing your home, take special notice of baseboard scuffs, loose handles, missing lightbulbs, and more. Small details make big impressions. In order to impress buyers, you want them to think there will be as little as possible to fix post-closing.

name: The Nose Knows
description: Odors, even slight ones, can be a major dealbreaker if you're trying to sell your home. The problem is, if you've been living in your home, you may not be able to detect them, Try inviting an unbiased third party into your home to detect any lingering pet smells or kitchen odors. If you find any, prepare to do some deep cleaning, too. Covering up a small with a stronger one may backfire if the buyer doesn't like citrus, lavender, or other common deoderizing scents.

name: Is Earnest Money Refundable?
description: Last time, we defined earnest money, but as one of the most mystifying parts of the home-buying process, here's some further explanation. Essentially, earnest money is the cash you use to "call dibs" on a property. And, the earnest money can equal up to ten percent of the purchase prices -- that's not small potatoes. Earnest money indicates seriousness. Without it, a buyer could potentially make multiple offers on multiple homes. However, the earnest money remains in excrow until closing, when it goes toward the purchase price. If you don't get to closing, there's a potential it could be forfetied, and here's why: 1) You've waived your contingencies.This does make you more attractive to sellers, but there's risk.  2) You ignored a timeline outlined in a contract and failed to secure financing, an inspection, or another crucial aspect on time. 3) You got cold feet. If there's no problem with the property and you simply had a change of heart, you may not get your earnest money back.

name: Closing Costs
description: Most people are aware that auxiliary closing costs might exist, but here's a non-exhaustive list of the less obvious ones: 1) A loan amount origin fee, which covers the charge for processing paperwork for a loan. 2) A fee for running your credit report. 3)An appraisalfee for the home. 3) A home inspection fee. 4) A title search to unearth any liens on the property. 5) A survey fee for single-family homes or town homes.

name: A Personal Touch
description: Given the competitive nature of the market, going outside of the box as a buyer could make you stand out. If you're certain a property you're looking at is you dream home, let the seller know! A handwritten letter explaining why you want the property and your hopes for it could make a difference. The human connection could end up being a signifcant factor in the seller's decision.
